2024-07-22

<2024-07-22 Mon 08:16>

ExportLogseq is far enough along that I can just about use it for publishing My Public Brain. Main top-of-mind missing piece is RSS. Still a lot of quality of life issues and 2017-2020 posts to pull in, but so close.

2024-07-17

<2024-07-17 Wed 11:43>

Working on distinct sections in the published site for Journals and Pages.

2024-04-07

Migrating My Public Brain to Logseq

Now I’ve got summary listings, custom for journal entries and posts. I think I like my idea of using journals as source for tumblelog-style microblogging. Pondering whether to fold the old notes experiment into this as well. It’s the same core idea, after all.

Next up is RSS. That’s a mandatory thing before going live with what I got.

2024-04-03

Last night I’m thinking “Hey I should try doing this public brain thing in Eleventy.” Then as I’m drifting off to sleep I remember “oh yeah I already did.”

GitHub - brianwisti/logseq-eleventy: Trying one way to publish a Logseq graph with Eleventy

2023-09-08

My reference section is way too cluttered. I want everything collapsed, where I can drill down further on the specifics I’m interested in. So in my graph’s config.edn I changed :ref/default-open-blocks-level from two to zero.

:ref/default-open-blocks-level 0
